item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, January 9, 2025 at 9:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: Tetris in a PDF (514 points | 101 comments)
2. WorstFit: Unveiling Hidden Transformers in Windows ANSI (144 points | 37 comments)
3. "Twelfth Night Till Candlemas" – a 40-year book-quest and its remarkable ending (80 points | 20 comments)
4. We are teen hackers from around the world who code together (14 points | 8 comments)
5. How Britain got its first internet connection (2018) (17 points | 12 comments)
6. Perpetual Movement: Francis Picabia's 391 Review (1917–1924) (8 points | discuss)
7. Show HN: Factorio Blueprint Visualizer (304 points | 72 comments)
8. David Lodge, British novelist who satirized academic life, has died (17 points | 5 comments)
9. Writing as Transformation (85 points | 22 comments)
10. Relax while watching bouncing particles making connections when they get closer (105 points | 41 comments)
11. NeuralSVG: An Implicit Representation for Text-to-Vector Generation (693 points | 65 comments)
12. MixRank (YC S11) Is Hiring Software Engineers Globally ( | hide)
13. Rational or Not? This Basic Math Question Took Decades to Answer (85 points | 59 comments)
14. Show HN: TabPFN v2 – A SOTA foundation model for small tabular data (21 points | 2 comments)
15. World's largest pumped storage power plant fully operational in China (26 points | 10 comments)
16. The cases of consumer-grade routers on puny power supplies (41 points | 10 comments)
17. Scientists uncover how the brain washes itself during sleep (235 points | 181 comments)
18. The Seven-Action Documentation Model (52 points | 6 comments)
19. Bad Moon Rising (36 points | 35 comments)
20. Cracking a 512-bit DKIM key for less than $8 in the cloud (743 points | 359 comments)
21. Agents Are Not Enough (114 points | 89 comments)
22. Writing a simple pool allocator in C (246 points | 112 comments)
23. Why clowns paint their faces on eggs (2017) (16 points | 4 comments)
24. Show HN: Atlas of Space (661 points | 114 comments)
25. Show HN: Stagehand – an open source browser automation framework powered by AI (274 points | 56 comments)
26. A swashbuckling tale of Italian software piracy – 1983-1993 (2022) (85 points | 36 comments)
27. Industrial photographer Christopher Payne spotlights the good in American labor (146 points | 26 comments)
28. Fidget (519 points | 48 comments)
29. I had to take down my course-swapping site or be expelled (1205 points | 584 comments)
30. The Complete Text of "All Watched over by Machines of Loving Grace" (50 points | 25 comments)
